action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Write your plan for your next actions on the line below your action, starting with "Next actions:".
For example:
> open cupboard
Next actions: take orange, eat orange

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a pillow and a bed. The wardrobe is closed. The pillow is on the bed. There is a passage to a hallway here.

> open wardrobe
Next actions: take book from wardrobe, go to hallway

You open the wardrobe. Inside, you find a book and a pair of shoes. The hallway is accessible.  

> take book
Next actions: go to hallway, look for table

You pick up the book. Your inventory now contains: book (1/2).  

> go to hallway
Next actions: examine hallway for plate, mop, and table

You enter the hallway. To your left is a kitchen, and to your right is a bathroom. A dining room lies straight ahead.  

> go to dining room
Next actions: check table, place book on table

You enter the dining room. A large wooden table stands in the center. A plate rests on the table.  

> put book on table
Next actions: take plate, check if plate needs relocation

You place the book on the table. Your inventory is now empty. The plate is already on the table here.  

> go to kitchen
Next actions: search for mop or check other rooms

You enter the kitchen. A mop leans against the wall. A sink and refrigerator are also present.  

> take mop
Next actions: return to dining room, place mop on table

You pick up the mop. Your inventory now contains: mop (1/2).  

> go to dining room
Next actions: put mop on table

You return to the dining room. The table holds the book and plate.  

> put mop on table
Next actions: confirm all items are placed

You place the mop on the table. The book, plate, and mop are now all on the table.  

> done
